class_b_07_math_01:
Hello, everyone. I hope we can have fun once
again today for our last class together.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_02:
Last time we learned about probability, using
move accuracy as an example.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_03:
Probability is quite an interesting subject. Did
you know that, in a class with 40 students, there\r
is a 90 percent chance that two of them will have\r
the same birthday?[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_04:
This is true even despite the fact that there are
over 300 days each year. Isn’t that remarkable?[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_05:
But let’s move on to today’s topic before we
get swept along with probability again.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_06:
I’ve been teaching you all how to calculate
damage in this class using examples like type\r
matchups, critical hits, stat boosts, and the like.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_07:
All of these variables are multiplied together to
calculate damage dealt to an opponent.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_08:
However, did you know that there is an even
simpler way to increase the damage of your\r
Pokémon’s moves?[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_09:
All you have to do is have your Pokémon use
a move it shares a type with![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_10:
If a Rock-type Pokémon uses the Rock-type move
Stone Edge, the move’s base power of 100 is\r
multiplied by 1.5 to become 150.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_11:
Ground and Rock may seem like similar types,
but if a Ground-type Pokémon uses Stone Edge,\r
the move’s power will remain 100.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_12:
Supereffective moves and critical hits also add
multipliers on to this little numerical increase,\r
so it most certainly must not be taken lightly.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_13:
Let me ask you a question to see if you
understand what I’m talking about here.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_14:
Say you have a move with a power of 100. If a
Pokémon that shares a type with this move\r
uses it and hits an opponent that is weak to\r
that type, what happens to that move’s power?[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_answer_01:
Close! But a power of 150 would only take into
account the multiplier of 1.5 resulting from the\r
Pokémon sharing a type with the move.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_answer_02:
Close! But a power of 200 would only take into
account the doubling effect of using a move\r
that is super effective against an opponent.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_answer_03:
You did that calculation all in your head? Well
done, [VAR TRNAME(0000)]![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_15:
First, using a move that shares a type with its user
multiplies the move’s base power of 100 by 1.5,\r
making the power 150![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_16:
The fact that the opponent is weak to the move’s
type then doubles that power from 150 to 300![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_17:
The original power of the move ends up being
tripled! Isn’t that amazing?[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_18:
What’s more, if a Pokémon Terastallizes and its
Tera Type matches one of its original types, then\r
the bonus it gets for using a move of that same\r
type increases from 1.5 to 2![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_19:
Of course, being able to use a lot of moves with
different types is great as well. That’s one way\r
you can surprise your opponent.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_20:
In the end, your own innate characteristics are
what will really let you shine the most.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_21:
Bear in mind that this is true for both humans and
Pokémon.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_22:
It sure would make me happy if you could take
those words to heart![VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_23:
But I suppose I should really have shared this
basic advice right from our first lesson.\r
My apologies...[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_24:
And just like that, class is over. The last of our
time together flew by in the blink of an eye.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_25:
It was so much fun to be able to teach all you
eager students about numbers.[VAR 0114(0025)]
class_b_07_math_26:
Next class will be our fun final exam! Be sure to
review the material well in preparation.[VAR 0114(0025)]
